hl.seg: France has supported the proposal.

doc.seg: The Chairman of the Committee of the Summit, Mushahid Hussain Syed said in the Committee meeting on Friday at the Parliament House about the proposal on the relief goods to Palestine and that a Parliamentary delegation has been sent.
After the meeting, Mushahid Hussain Syed said to the representatives of media that the Committee at France has welcomed the proposal for the relief work for the affected people in the Gaza Strip.
He said that the Israeli attack is a crime on humanity and that all the countries should condemn the attacks.
While Mushahid Hussain criticize the world to double standards, said that the people should be against terrorism, but they are still against the Palestinians in the attacks.
The foreign affairs Minister in the Senate Standing Committee Chairman and the leaders of the Muslim Ummah were also criticized.
He said that the Committee expressed hope that the newly elected President of the United States Barak, will address the Muslim Ummah in his first one hundred days.
Mushahid Hussain Syed said that Muslims and the West would give not only the emergency steps for Kashmir but also for the long standing problems like Palestine.
Imaduddin Khan, the Minister of External Affairs and the state of the committee said that Saudi Arabia attended the meeting for the foreign ministers of the Islamic countries of the Organization.

The emergency meeting by Israel as the result of the attacks was summoned. He said that the fashion of Palestine is aware and that the Government of other countries should be in touch with leaders in this regard.
The Minister of External Affairs of State said that the Palestine issues should be resolved according to the UN resolutions .
Two Arab journalists attended the meeting on the latest situation of Palestine.
On the other hand, the International University students participated in a protest at Islamabad against the Israeli attacks on Palestine.
The demonstrators also displayed banners and slogans against Israel.

hl.seg: In order to better resist flu, quit dieting.

doc.seg: According to the American Scientist this research has come out after many experimentations on rats.
Experiments have proved that those rats on lower calories diets developed a tendency not to overcome the flu virus .
This Research has proved wrong the very old saying that it is better to starve a fever.
According to the scientist a patient should eat more during a fever.

According to the Researchers of the State of Michigan University dieting rats have less strength to fight infection and their chances of death increased, whereas earlier those rats on a common diet had more strength to fight the flu virus.
According to Professor Elizabeth Cardener, people on diets will be more susceptible to the flue virus and may also take longer to recover once infected.
The professor recommends that people who have taken the flue vaccination, discontinue their diet over the summer in order to elude the virus.

hl.seg: The first nuclear test was in 1990.

doc.seg: Thomas Red, former director of Cooperation at the National Laboratory Technical Committee of Los Angeles, has written a book.

Thomas C. Reed and Danny B. Stillman wrote the Book, The Nuclear Express: A Political History of the Bomb and Its Proliferation. They conclude that the U.S. has tested an atom bomb and may also house nuclear secrets.
In a 1970 interview with USAID news, Thomas Red stated that when Benazir Bhutto was the leader in Pakistan, China conducted its first nuclear bomb experiment.
According to Thomas Red, there are several reasons to beleive that China has tested a nuclear bomb.
Evidence suggests that Chinese scientists designed the bomb.
Red went on to say that, in 1990, both India and Pakistan tested their nuclear bomb capabilities within two weeks of each other.
Thomas Red reiterates that Russia tested nuclear capabilities 17 days after a nuclear test by the United States in 1970.
He further said that in May 1998, Pakistan had mentioned the atom bomb experiment in the Pakistani scientists' confidence.
When Thomas Red was questioned about the nuclear technology that China had provided to Pakistan, he said that they have a common enemy: India.
He said Chinese designer Dr. Khan has the proof after which the documents from Libya in this connection have been confirmed.
The question of the nuclear tests are by the United States and the British in the deserts.
He said that Israel has also experienced the same result.
To Thomas Red, the most pressing question about China's nuclear program is the ""proliferation.""
Thomas Red said that from 1970 to 1991, the Iranian city of China had set up the nuclear installation for the raw material and for providing instructions.
In addition to this, China has also provided a Uranium plant to Iran.
He said that there are nuclear relations among China, North Korea, Iran, Syria, Egypt, Libya, Pakistan and Yemen.

hl.seg: The best year for Madonna was 2008.

doc.seg: This show was arranged on the basis of Madonna's album 'Hard Candy' and included a few numbers with ethnic Ukrainian bands as well as Justin Timberlake.
An old racing car was also placed on the stage during the show.
The second most successful show of 2008, based on profit, was Celine Dion's, which earned $236,600,000.
The Canadian show 'Taking Chances' toured 24 countries while Madonna, on her first tour in eight years, went to 17 countries.
The director for both singers was Jimmy King, who also organized the 'Reunion' tour for 'Spice Girls'.
Madonna has broken her own 2006 record.
In 2006 she earned $193,700,000 through the 'Confession Concerts'.
Pollster has named Bon Jovi the third most successful singer, earning $176,000,000.
Bruce Springsteen was number three, earning $166,000,000 while Police checked in at the 5th position, earning $120,600,000.
According to this publication, 2008 attendance records at concerts in North America had fallen and only those willing to buy expensive tickets saw live acts.
In America, the cost of a ticket is increased by an average of 8 percent yearly. The most expensive ticket was sold for 300 dollars at Madonna's show.
The editor of Pollster, Gary Bongioni, said in prospect of the international financial crisis, year 2008 proved to be good.
He predicted 2009 a good year for U2 and Springsteen, whose albums are about to be release.

hl.seg: Ban on coeducation: Taliban

doc.seg: Local Talibans of the Gul Bahadur group have distributed a pamphlet in Miran Shah (Capital of Southern Waziristan) and in other Tehsils in which government and semi-government coeducational institutes have been threatened.
The pamphlet stated that if coeducation institutes are not closed by the 5th of January, action will be taken against them.
The pamphlet said that women are banned to have ID Cards for government aid and for educational purposes, and women are prohibited to go to NADRA's Offices in all Tehsils.
The announcement on the ban of women ID Card has been made at a time when almost 200 women have submitted forms in NADRA Offices in Southern Waziristan for Benazir Income Support Program.
According to local people, the pamphlet issued by Taliban was announced on the loudspeakers of all the Masjids.
However, it was not mentioned in the letter that separate educational institutipns for women are banned.

According to the pamphlet, after this announcement, any woman caught in the school getting an education or in NADRA's Office for having an ID Card will be punished by religious law, along with her family.
Moreover, the Police in Bannu District say that on Sunday, a landmine exploded on Miram Shah Bannu Road, killing one traveler and wounding another.
Injured people have been admitted to the Civil Hospital.

hl.seg: More bodies were recovered from the targeted killings.

doc.seg: According to the police, two bodies were removed from the Green Chowk Mingora areas on Sohrab Khan Chowk.
The Police said that they were killed in the Frontier Corps.
The dead bodies were found at 11 pm and witnesses say that a letter was there near the dead bodies which said that they themselves are responsible for their deaths.
Local people say that at around 11 pm dead bodies were lying in the market. However, security personnel have shifted the two bodies.
Targeted killings have increased to a dangerous extent in the Mingora and nearby areas during the last few weeks.
Mostly common citizens, including women and security personnel, were killed.
According to local sources, such incidents involve more than 30 people.
So far, no organization has taken responsibility for the killings.

On Saturday, a spokesman from the Taliban told the BBC in the local Taliban Muslim Khan, that three of his colleagues bodies had been found on Friday. It included the body of the Taliban commander Rafi.
Muslim Khan told that Rafi was in the custody of security forces for the last month and a half.
He stated that when local Taliban kill, they first issue a notice. This has put common citizens of the Mingora area in a lot of anxiety.
The people of Mingora say that groups of security forces are there to help control the attacks but in spite of this, attacks on the citizens have increased.

hl.seg: Bakhtawar has dedicated a musical tribute to Benazir.

doc.seg: Bakhtawar has recorded a rap song in the modern music genre that is now posted on You Tube.
The song is five minutes long and portrays Benazir's life in pictures and clips.
The singer is an eighteen year old student from Edinburgh University.
She has a deep interest in singing and poetry.
It is believed that she started singing after being encouraged by her mother, and started doing so only as a hobby.
She paid tribute to her mother, who she called both intelligent and beautiful, and described as always doing everything in her own way.
Talking about the incident of December 27th, she said that her mother was shot at the temple. She died at the age of 54 and left 3 children behind.
The whole nation is seeking direction without her, and she is present in everyone's heart.
Miss Bakhtawar is the second child of Benazir Bhutto after her 20 year old brother, Bilawal Bhutto.
She has taken a keen interest in music from the start.

Its believed that before her mother's return to Pakistan, she tried to have a meeting arranged with Grammy Award winning music producer and rapper Sean ""P.Diddy"" Combs through a journalist friend, but this meeting never took place.
Miss Bakhtawar's poetry has been translated and published in some Sindhi newspapers, but this is the first time that her voice can be heard via YouTube.
The workers and followers of Benazir Bhutto have started recording CDs of her song.
Mr. Farhatullah Babar, spokesman of Pakistan Peoples Party, has confirmed that both the song’s poetry and vocals on YouTube are performed by Bakhtawar.

He was speaking on the phone from Islamabad and said that it is a tribute of a grief-stricken daughter to her courageous mother and has been aired by Pakistan Television, the national television network of Pakistan.
He further stated that the Peoples Party has not made any plans to distribute the music CDs by Miss Bakhtawar as of yet.
He said that a few months back, a fake account of the young Bilawal Bhutto Zardari, the chairman of Pakistan Peoples Party, was made on the website of Facebook, but it was later closed down.

hl.seg: Ajmal butcher is : THE Pakistani INFORMATION Minister

doc.seg: The Federal Minister for Information and Broadcasting, Sherry Rahman, was sent to THE BBC Urdu Service. In a message, SMS Ajmal confirmed The citizenship of the Butcher. More are under investigation.
Prior to this, Rahman, Advisor of the Prime Minister, refused his Pakistani citizenship.
He said that he had no record of citizens in the NADRA organization.
With this latest announcement, the Pakistani Government has now reversed its stance since the Ajmal butcher has confirmed his citizenship.
However, a Foreign Ministry spokesman reported that Ajmal has confirmed his citizenship.
Prior to this, the BBC Urdu Service and a few other newspapers and TV channels reported that Ajmal was from Farid town, Okara district, Punjab Province.
However, the government had been refused comment.
It is not clear now that this is concerned with Farid Kot of Ajmal or any other area.

hl.seg: Rocket Fire from Lebanon too, and bombing in response.

doc.seg: Israeli Army and Police officials have informed the press that four rockets were launched from Lebanon on to Israeli land, one of which hit the Northern part of Israel in Naharia, which injured two people.
In response to the rockets launched from Lebanon, Israeli tanks bombed Lebanon.
It's not certain that this attack was Hezbollah related or if aggravated Palestinian terrorists are behind this.
The Lebanese government has said that they are also trying to investigate who is behind these rocket attacks.
The reporters of BBC have declared this an entirely volatile and dangerous situation.
According to the Head of the Middle East sector of BBC, Jeremy Button, these rocket attacks have increased the chances of spreading the war.
In the past few days, it is feared that the Investigation in Gaza might extend to the Northern part of Lebanon and also to the Israeli border.
Israeli forces have executed around 60 aerial attacks on the Gaza strip, between Wednesday and Thursday nights.
According to the Israeli army, they targeted the Hamas Police offices, tunnels, weapon stores, rocket launching areas and armed individuals, in these attacks.
Apart from aerial attacks, Gaza was also bombed throughout night, from the Israeli and Bahria tank bases.
Palestinian sources say that a mosque was destroyed in the aerial attacks on Gaza.
According to some unconfirmed sources, Israeli tanks are closing in on the area of Khan Younis, with aerial help from helicopters.
In the last twelve days, around 700 Palestinians have been killed, a majority of them being women and children.
On the other hand, 11 Israeli soldiers have also lost their lives.
Israeli Security Forces have confirmed that a high ranked officer, Amos Gailad, has left for Cairo to discuss about the conditions for a ceasefire.
A member of Hamas is also leaving for Cairo, to have talks with the Egyptian Ambassador.
Also, a member of the Palestinian authority, Mahmood Abbas, will be arriving in Cairo on Friday.

hl.seg: My heart is broken, give me back my kidney.

doc.seg: Dr. Richard Batista has said that eight years ago, he gave his wife Danelle his kidney to save her life.
According to some press reports, Dr. Batista has said that his wife repaid him for his gift by betraying him, having relations with someone else, and petitioning for divorce.
In an interview with a local paper, Dr. Batista said that this situation has left him with a broken heart.
According to Dr. Richard Batista's lawyer, he is asking for his kidney back, but in reality is looking for monetary compensation for his kidney.
According to his wife, they will be appearing before a judge in this matter, in the next few days.

hl.seg: 140 year old, 9 kilo lobster Freed.

doc.seg: ""George the Giant Lobster"" was caught in the sea two weeks earlier.
A seafood company of the city had bought him for 100 dollars.
They immediately starting using the lobster as means of advertisement.
But a group for animal rights, ""PETA"", demanded the lobster's release; now he is in the sea again.
George was caught in a sea in Canada, after which he spent ten days in the tank of ""City Crab and Seafood Company.""
The age of a lobster can usually be determined by its weight.
According to the restaurant manager, Keith Wallanty, the lobster was not meant to be harmed, and was put into the tank only to arouse curiosity with their customers.
According to a member of PETA, Ingrid Newkirk, the decision of the restaurant is admirable and serves as an example to those who only want to keep the animal in a tank or boil them and eat them.

hl.seg: A girl was traced with the help of a mobile.

doc.seg: When officials came to know about Natali Maltrice, firefighters and police of Athol City, Massachusetts started the action.
Officials located the exact location of the girl with the help of a GPS in her mobile.
However, it was with the help of Google Street View that she was found in a hotel.
A week earlier Natali's grandmother Rose Maltice took Natali with her from supervision of her legal parents.
The police chief of Athol Timothy Anderson told BBC, she said that now she will never return Natali and then she left the state.
Police Contacted Mrs. Maltice, but when he did not returned Natali despite of promise then police decided to find him with the help of Natali's cell.
Since 2005 it is in the law of America that Mobile companies have to provide location of callers 67 percent of callers at a distance of 100 meters and 95 percent of at 300 meters.

hl.seg: Hamid Karzai on India's tour

doc.seg: It is the 2nd tour of India by Hamid Karzai in last five months.
It is hoped that he will discuss the state of affairs after the terrorists attack on Mumbai while in meeting with Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.
During this tour he wishes to deliver emotions of Afghanistan and her people and express his unanimity with India.
During this tour of Karzai other then extremism bilateral trade will also be discussed.
Bilateral cooperation between the two for countering extremism is also hoped to be discussed.
During his last tour of India, President Hamid Karzai said that extremism will not be allowed to hinder the relations of the two countries.
He also said that both India and Afghanistan are facing the challenge of extremism, ruthlessness, and assassinations.
Peace and solidarity in both countries is beneficial for the area and the world as well.
We understand the fact that if both countries and the whole world unite, then can eliminate the curse of terrorism.
It must be noted that Karzai had blamed the Pakistani intelligence agency ISI for the attack on the Indian Embassy in Kabul in July of last year.
4 Indians and an officer of IFS were killed in this attack.

After the attack on the Embassy during the Karzai's tour of India, Manmohan Singh said that the attack was against the friendship of India and Afghanistan, and that they have agreed that will not allow extremism to hinder their relations.

hl.seg: A special Judge has been nominated for the hearings on the Mumbai attack.

doc.seg: The Mumbai police commissioner Hassan Ghafoor said that the extremists involved with the Mumbai attacks were arrested alive. The accused Ajmal Ameer is the only terrorist arrested with this case.
Also, a special lawyer has been appointed on behalf of the accused for the case.
Ajmal is presently in the custody of the police and it is expected that the police may be filing a charge sheet against him, before January 24.
Ajmal asks for a lawyer, to defend him.
He has sent a letter appealing to the Government of Pakistan, for legal Help.
It is said that enough evidence is available to confirm that Pakistani extremists are involved in the attacks on Mumbai, India.
Pakistan has accepted Ajmal as its citizen.
According to the case filed by the police, Additional Police Commissioner Ashok, Police Inspector Vijay and six more policemen were killed, while Ajmal and his companion Abu Ismail were caught.
Ismail Khan got killed when the police acted in defence, and police have arrested Ajmal alive.
A lawyer has not yet been nominated in the case, on behalf of the Ajmal.
The Government has accepted to give the legal aid cell. The lawyer Dinesh Mota was nominated but he refused to take the case on moral grounds.
Lawyers from the opposition political party have been protesting against this.

hl.seg: Council: 'comittee has been chosen'

doc.seg: On tuesday in Isalamabad after a seminar on environmental changes discussing with media people he said that i this period a group parliment party will be reqired in which this comittee will be chosen.
He said until now, group movement has been chosen and has been placed in the assembly whereas the other political parties will also be placed before Parliament.
He also told for the end of satarwin party Pakistan public party has sent a notice to all political parties and committee will also go through this notice.
In one of his answers to the questions he said that the issue between leader and minister is going to be sought out in Parliament.
The prime minister said Parliament has all rights for making decisions.

In one of his answers he also said that leader retired General Parwez Musharraf has been asked to quit the position of army prime minister and Pakistani chair person Benazzir Bhutto have also their roles very important who gave emphasis on universal brotherhood and also emphasized on leader parwez Musharraf to remove his uniform
He also said that American leader Joe Biden is in favor of Pakistan and the south and for his services the leader of Pakistan has honored him.

""After the Mumubai attack, every kind of relationship between India and Pakistan will be broken regarding this,"" answering a question Yussof Raza Lihalini sad, ""The Indian government are under pressure hence they give this type of warnings.""

hl.seg: The dismissal of journalists was protested.

doc.seg: On Tuesday, the journalists in Islamabad went on a protest in front of the press club. Newspaper workers, TV journalists, and employees of newspapers and large media companies raised protest slogans.

Addressing the protesters, the journalists of major newspapers in the Federal Union of Journalists of Pakistan said that the protests were against politicians. Newspaper owners joined them due to the fear for the rights of journalists.
He said that the human rights to the newspaper owners should be assured by these organizations. The punishment and imprisonment of workers may lead to loss of billions of rupees in annual profits.
An example of this is that channel five, a private TV station in Lahore. A member commited suicide for not recieving salary, and many workers are anxious because they haven't been paid in months.
He said that the TV and newspaper owners were on a permanent protest in front of parliament, saying that steps should be taken for the rights of journalists.
Salman, the governor of Punjab and solar energy advocate, complained to the Urdu newspaper Today that the employees were not given any notice.
Dozens of employees were also dismissed at The Daily Jinnah, Daily News Channel, Plus Five, Business TV and TV Today.

The BJP and the secretary general of the demonstrators, Mazhar Abbas, said while addressing to the country today that his journalists and others have tied black bandages on their arms as part fo their protest for the rights of journalists.
According to the Pakistan Mazhar Abbas, 85 percent of workers at newspapers and TV channels are being exploited, without no contract at the place where they are working.

He said that so far, more than 200 journalists and workers at newspapers and TV channels have been fired in the current year by the owners, and feared that hundreds more workers may be dismissed because of the economic crisis.

The Mazhar Abbas Attiya demonstrations will continue until the dismissed journalists are re-hitred and the newspaper workers' wages are determined by the committee. The implementation of the rulings by the TV channels and newspapers concerning their employees' salaries has been delayed for many months.

hl.seg: Those outside of Kabina has raised their voices.

doc.seg: The new prime minister Atique Ahmed Khan is from the Mukhalif Muslim conference, which includes the Pakistani Popular Party, Pakistan Muslim League, and the Khaimi Movement.
Vazeer Bee is the only woman among the 11 members of Kabina, and she is connected to the Atique Mukhalif group.
The Ajmal butcher is the Pakistani Information Minister.
Results from Nizra were announced later.
Before Alaf Bindari, the Public Party had raised slogans in favor of Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto.

hl.seg: The virus has affected 350,000 people.

doc.seg: The virus was first identified on October 8, 2008 and was named later.
Even though anti-virus defenses and preparations were ready, nearly 35 million computers were affected by this virus.
Experts say that the computers affected may be even more than this.
For dealing with the consumers meeting the criteria for sites to the 'zero zero associate 2000 suture' plight needs to be used.
The criteria for sites that has visits from hundreds or thousands of people to file using the virus 'services Cork E. E.', should have a search and include a Code.
After this, the virus in the enthusiastic leap XP system of an LLB will be in any of the file.
Is this virus in the name of this file creation.
Then the registration of XP details in the computer will change.
The virus after active comes into the machine and the server and accommodate a point to change.
After this, the download of files from the Web site becomes slow.
Depending upon the criteria of sites in the world, the virus affects the computers in different countries.
This includes countries like Brazil, China, Russia, India, the United States and Britain.

hl.seg: Delivery of The Indian Information.

doc.seg: On Saturday, after the meeting, the Interior Minister spoke to the media about India.
The issue of help for the investigation.
He said that Pakistan is an independent country, separate from India, and is not receiving any news concerning the investigation of the country.
Daily calls will not be accepted.
He said that in addition to the information received, other news from India was forthcoming .
The interior minister said that at least 124 members of the Peace team are feared to have been arrested under the law which bans organizations.
And if there are no charges against some people, then the reason for their arrest and incarceration will be released.
In response to a question, he said that one individual was arrested in connection with India and that action against him will be taken under the provisions of Pakistani laws.
He said that the law will be used against the people of FIA.

In response to a question, he said that the Indian law enforcing agencies in Mumbai has given the information to the international community in 42 days and he hopes that the investigation will be for India and Pakistan at the same time.
The government has to offer again to repeat the investigation of Mumbai incident and a joint team should be formed.
It should be noted that a three-member team was formed from India for the Mumbai attacks under the leadership of additional director general of the FIA.
Pakistan is to investigate on the Information.

Pakistan's High Commissioner Shahid Malik met the President Asif Ali Zardari and has clarified that if any Pakistani individual or group was found to be involved in attacks of Mumbai then action will be taken in India and Pakistan.

hl.seg: Everything is possible in America

doc.seg: Mr Obama took the oath on 20th january as the fortieth president of America
Tomorrow there will be an address on the stairs of the Lincoln Memorial which has been built to honor the 16th President of the United States in Washington
Mr Obama said that America is facing one of the greatest challanges in its history , but he was very hopeful that America will take control of all the problems
Abrahim Lincoln freed the nations from the shakles of slavery.
Mr. Obama said that our country is facing a lot of problems, and it will take a lot of time and effort to solve them.
But even so, I am still hopeful that our nation's ideology will survive.
Other then the Iraq and Afghanistan wars, America has also been facing extreme financial problems.
Special arrangements have been made for the inauguration.
According to the government, two million people are attending this gathering.
Monday is a national holiday in America because on this day one of the greatest saviour of human rights, Martin Luther King, Jr. was born.
Martin Luther King was a black man.

hl.seg: Tribute to the work of Martin Luther King.

doc.seg: Dr. Martin Luther King was assassinated in 1968.
Barack Obama pad tribute to Dr. King, and asked Americans to work together to fulfill their promises.
In Washington preparations are taking place for the arrangements of unprecedented gathering of people for the new President oath ceremony on Tuesday.
Almost two million people are expected to gather to see this historical President Oath.
Barack Obama has started Monday by visiting a medical center in Northern Washington where he met wounded American soldiers afterwards he went to a shelter for homeless and painted a wall.
Talking to correspondents Barack Obama said: The current crisis we are having and the problems many people are facing,in this situation we can't sit and relax.
He said that Martin Luther King has spent his life in serving people.
Barack Obama said that today when we are remembering him, this is not the day to stay and think. It is the day to act.
He said that Tuesday's ceremony will be held on the same place where thousands of people gathered for Martin Luther King's 'I have a dream' in 1963.
In this speech Martin Luther King said that the day will come when people will not be differentiated on the base of their color.
Mathew Price of BBC says that it is the tragedy of history that the day of Martin Luther is 24 hours earlier then the day when first black President of America will sworn in.
For many in southern states of America the Presidency of Barack Obama, will be the interpretation of Martin Luther King's dream.

hl.seg: Additional Political agent raw

doc.seg: Additional political agent was kidnapped ten days ago from South Uzbekistan by some masked people.
Resources indicate that the agent, was kidnapped to Mulla nazeer group's residence.
According to residential sources, on Tuesday at 4 pm Waziretan's additional political agent, Amir Latif will be moved to Jarge Scouts camp.
It was not revealed that an additional political agent was kidnapped.
Local people informed that the agent was kidnapped by the Talibans.
Amir Latif was kidnapped when he was leaving for Tang.
On 11th January 2009, in South Uzbekistan's Kahlbi region seven masked people kidnapped additional political agent with the driver.
According to resources first the kidnappers inspected the vehicle and then the additional agent was taken away in a vehicle.

Due to kidnap of additional political agent, security forces posted check points in south Uzbekistan and near khabili areas. They are also checking all the vehicles passing by and declared it as a restricted area for a weak.

on 8th December 2008 southern Uzbekistan s assistant political agent Azmatullah was also kidnapped at the same time when he was going for festival from meer ali to banu after few days in southern uzhbekistan with tashildaar amaanullah two people were killed by masked people.

hl.seg: British Hacker wins in court

doc.seg: 42 years British citizen has admitted that he had hacked American Army website.
Gary is suffering from Asperger syndrome. Keep in mind that the patient of Asperger syndrome has insanity of doing similar tasks.
According to his lawyers, it is feared he may attempt suicide if handed over to America .
All government attorneys says that there are very fewer doubts about Gary's health.
Lord Justice Moors and Mr. Justice Simon has said that Gary is permitted to file an application for reconsideration in the British court.
Gary's lawyers stated in the court that if Garry is kept away from his family and home, he can commit suicide.
Further they said that Interior Secretary did not consider this issue.
But government's attorneys says that Interior Secretary had used his powers.
Gary has never denied hacking the American Army website.
Gary hacked American computer systems in 2001 and 2002, due to which American Government suffered a loss of 8,00,000 dollars.
Gary hacked 97 systems including the American Navy and NASA.
However Gary says that they did not hack with ill intent; rather, they were looking for information on aliens which they think were kept secret by American Government.
Gary's mother Jenes Sharp said that she is happy with the decision.
Gary's lawyer said it's a good decision.
This case has been in the court system since 2002, and at last there is a correct decision.

hl.seg: The commander of Kashmir said two people were killed.

doc.seg: The Lieutenant Colonel of the Indian army deployed in Jammu told BBC that Jammu and Kashmir police have received information about 24 rashtria jantadal rifles in the authentical district, gandwah Doda district and in the jungle of Haus.
He fired on the army when the army was in action. Two armed extremist were killed.

The spokesman said that the extremists had killed two persons in the 12 years in the district of Hizbul where the Mujahideen has been active from 1960 in this district. The commander is also an expert in landmine blast.
It is suspected that Sajjad Hussain may be associated with them.
According to the bid, the rural areas are still in an operation according to the extremists. Two Kalashnikov rifles were also recovered by the army in the first phase .
The head of the police for the province of Urdu urged yesterday to cooperate to make this year the most peaceful year.
It is worth mentioning that there has been no violence in the November and December during the assembly elections.
There have been more than 100 candidates in this year's election.
Hizbul Mujahideen has made it clear that there has been no attack in the last 18 years in Jammu and Kashmir.
The opposition party announced in the year 2000 July for the first time after which, the Government of India and opposition party had talks with commanders.
However, it was just within 15 days that the ceasefire was broken.
Later, Hizbul Mujahideen have killed many high commanders.
It was reported on Thursday in the Pakistani newspaper 'Daily News' about the Pakistan's extremist groups living in Kashmir, Hizbul Mujaheddin and Lashkar-e-Tayiba.
It should be kept in mind that now with the policy of two organizations the Kashmir issue can be resolved through the armed resistance.

hl.seg: Dera Bugti: Explosion on gas pipe line

doc.seg: According to police officials, the explosion has destroyed a pipeline of an 18 inch diameter on the Loti Gas Field to Pir Koh.
This pipeline was directed towards Sui Plant.
Moreover, the spokesman form the banned 'Baloch Republican Army' has accepted the responsibility for the explosion on behalf of his organization on phone.
Fourth pipeline has been blown up in four days.
An 18"" pipeline was destroyed in Dera Allah Yar on Friday. Its mending was continued until Sunday morning.
General Manager of Sui Southern Gas Company, Mushtaq Siddiqui, told in Quetta that the supply line will restart in the afternoon.
This pipeline arrives to Quetta via Sibbi.

For three days, there have been severe gas shortages in Quetta, Ziarat and their suburbs. Snowfall is continuing and temperatures have dropped below the freezing point, and stoves and heaters are not working.
Also, in the city of Dera Bugti, a motorbike exploded in the animal market, but police report no casulaties.

hl.seg: Administrator for Jamat-al-qaeda

doc.seg: The headquarters of Jamat-al-qaeda is located 25 kilometers away from Central Tayiba Lahore, at Maridka
This center has hospitals, schools and hostels for students.
Rana Sana-ullah Khan, the minister of law of Punjab, said that the Jamat-al-Qaeda is under supervision, and the present welfare work going on will not be disturbed.

hl.seg: Four new members were added to the cabinet yesterday.

Two Ministers from the MQM, Farooq Sattar and Babar Ghori, were present. Besides them there were Azam Sawati and Ata-ur-Rahman of Jamiat-ulamaye-islam Fazlur-Rahman group, also present for the ceremony.
The selection announcement of the Tahal has not been released yet.
Farooq Sattar is the Convenor of the MQM Group. Babar Ghori is a Senator of that group, and their tenure is going to end on 10th March.

Maulana Ata-ur-Rahman is a member of the Communal Assembly and is also a younger brother of Fazlur-Rahman.

On November 3, 2008, 22 new ministers and 18 other new members were included in the cabinet. There were plans to include members from the MQM group as well. But as it happened, MQM group members were not included.

hl.seg: A pipeline has been blown up in Baluchistan.

doc.seg: According to police, it is an 18 inches of diameter pipeline which runs to Sui Gas Plant from various wells of Pir Koh, and it was blown up by some unknown armed persons early in the morning.
Moreover, yesterday well number 3 was completely destroyed by explosives and a pipeline was damaged in an explosion near Dera Allah Yar.
The responsibility has been claimed by Sarbaz Baluch on behalf of his organization, a banned organization of the Baluch Liberation Army.
Incidents of terrorism have increased in early 2009.
In this months dozens of pipelines have been exploded, and attacks on trains and Punjabis have multiplied.
The Chief Minister of Baluchistan, Nawab Aslam Raeesani, has reponded to these incidents and ordered police to share information with secret agencies, but these incidents couldn't be stopped.

hl.seg: The $819 billion economic stimulus package has been approved.

doc.seg: No member of the Republican Party has voted President Obama's plan.

The economic stimulus plan will be presented in the Senate next week, where the ruling Democratic Party has a smaller majority.
It is feared, due to the strong opposition from the Republican Party, that approval from the Senate will not be easy.
After the approval of the economic stimulus plan from the House, Barack Obama insisted that opponents must not be allowed to hinder the plan.
The president said this plan, which he hopes to sign into law next month, will help to establish a favorable atmosphere in which American trade will get better.

According to this plan, there will be $75 billion of tax cuts, and $500 billion will be allocated for renovation of roads, bridges, 10,000 schools, unemployment allowance and for research of new technology.

The BBC's Washington correspondent has said that Barack Obama had resolved to introduce a new political culture by ignoring the political differences, but discussion on this economic package has produced political bitterness.

In the House The members of the Republican party declared the government's proposed bill as waste of government finances and said that it will not be helpful in creating new opportunities for employment.
They insisted on the bill proposed by their party in which tax rebates are more focused upon.
They said by their package much less investment will be able to generate more employment opportunities.
They said that in place of construction plans, tax rebates can produce more employment opportunities instantly.

hl.seg: The role of European Union for the peace in Middle East

doc.seg: Officially, the European Union plays a decisive role in the mediatory efforts taken for stopping the war in Middle East.
It is the official stand of Brussels, that Schwarzenberg delegation or efforts of Sarkozy offer helping hands in this process.
Spokesman for European Union, Mr.Amadeu Altafaj said every single step which may help in delivering the collective message of European Union to the fighting parties, is appreciable.

The role of Czech Republic, as the President of the Union, is already weak.
plus, internal affairs has made her helpless.
On the other hand, the course of action chosen by the French President Sarkozy depicts that France is still the President of European Union.
Although, the 6 months' tenure of Presidency of France is over
Sarkozy wants to play a leading role and he is quite capable too; but he is not the authority.
French Foreign Minister Bernard Kouchner faces the most pleasant task.
He is in the delegation which is led by Schwarzenberg, the Foreign Minister of the Czech Republic.
In addition, the two foreign ministers are giving different statements on the war in Middle East.

Schwarzenberg says that Israel has the right to defend herself, while according to Kouchner war is not the answer. Germany has also sent a special ambassador to the Middle East. As long as European Union does not show a unanimous stand, she can not be successful on the diplomatic front.
The proof is that Israel has ignored the EU's diplomatic efforts.
This is the best time for European Union to prove herself, as American diplomacy has failed in the Middle East due to the policies of George W. Bush.

hl.seg: Financial crisis: German millionaire industrialist commits suicide.

doc.seg: Adolf Marclay, a resident of Swabia in south Germany has left behind a huge industrial company.
But he was not well known to German public until recently.
When he had to negotiate with 30 banks for weeks regarding his debts towards industrial companies, he became big news, and could see the dark future for the Marckay Group.
Marclay Group had to bear the loss of hundreds of millions of euros after it bought the shares from the known industry, Folks Wigan.
The financial institutes rejected to provide the much needed one billion euros to this group and this exerted severe pressure on Marclay.

Recently the same banks accepted to provide a loan to Marclay group on urgent basis. Adolf Marclay who started as a small industrialist, has industrial group's annual income reached 30 billion euros, couldn't bear the the loss in his financial strength.
After the death of his father, Adolf Marclay took the responsibility of the business. He used modern methods to make his business more successful.
He named his company Ratiopharm which is now Germany's most successful and biggest pharmaceutical company.

Until recent times this pharmaceutical company had a budget of around 5 to 6 billion euros and is now earning around 8 billion euros annually. After the great success of Rasue farm the Marclay Group bought many big industries such as Hi-Del Barag Cement, a manufacturer of construction equipment as well as Kassbohrer, a good car maker.
Marclay Group has a employee number of around 100 thousand around the world and among its industries, Rasue Farm has always been given special importance.
Adolf Marclay has said this many times in his life. """"We have been in pharma business since four generations"""".
Now the industry is handled by his children and I hope that it continues to progress for a few hundred years by our family.

After the suicide of Adolf Marclay,the banks have given approval of temporary loan of 400 million euro for his group VEM, but on the condition that VEM has to be sold to Rasio Farm in order to improve the financial position of this group.
After the death of Adolf Marclay, the Marclay Group will not remain the same as it was before.

hl.seg: Crime rate of foreigners living in Germany

9% has reduced to .21%

Senator Christoph Ahlhaus of CDU's Interior Ministry said: ""When the scientific research is conducted one can not draw results of his own rather they depend on the data which is calculated after research.

The crime rate by foreigners crime rate was less than the general population of the province.
crime rate is less then the crimes committed in the whole province.

7 percent.

hl.seg: U.S. Vice President Joe Biden arrived in Pakistan.

doc.seg: The foreign minister welcomed the U.S. Vice President.
The United States sent Vice President Joe Biden on a visit to Pakistan. On Friday the delegation arrived in Islamabad.
External Affairs Minister, Shah Mahmood Qureshi, and the American embassy officials welcomed him.
American Senator Lindsey Graham is also accompanying Biden.

Lew Fenter, Press Officer of the American Embassy, told Voice of America that the newly elected President will be discussing several regional affairs with the Pakistani Leadership during his tour, however, he refused to disclose any further details.
According to the Foreign Affairs Ministry, Joseph Biden will also be meeting with Army Chief General Ashfaq Pervez Kiani along with other high officials from the government.
It is hoped that in these meetings, other important bilateral and international affairs will be discussed as well as the war against terrorism.
Joseph Biden has been awarded the Hilal e Pakistan medal.
After arriving to Islamabad, Joseph Biden met with President Asif Ali Zardari.
During that meeting, the President awarded him the Hilal e Pakistan medal for his role in the establishment of closer ties between America and Pakistan.

It should be noted that Joseph Biden as Chairman of Foreign Affairs Committee of the American Senate along with Senator Richard Lugar presented a bill which proposed a three times increase in civilian aid for next five years to Pakistan, taking it to 5.7 billion dollars.

hl.seg: The USA must remain vigilant against enemy attacks: Bush

doc.seg: In his last weekly speech over radio, President George Bush insisted upon USA to be vigilant against enemy attacks .
Mr.Bush said the biggest threat for America is the possibility of one more attack by terrorists. He warned that the enemies of the States are waiting patiently and they are planning to attack again.
The Out-going President said that the USA must never be negligent of her defence.
President Bush conveyed his best wishes for President-elect Barack Obama, who will be sworn in on Tuesday.
President-elect Barack Obama threw light from the platform of Democratic party, on the historical importance of Oath ceremony, in his weekly speech on radio.
He said that the ceremony is such a tradition, in which the peaceful transfer of powers gets deeply tied to American greatness.
Mr.Obama reminded that many people cannot even imagine that their leaders will quit the authority without struggle or bloodshed.

hl.seg: Political and security issues were discussed at the meeting in Raiwind between the Sharif brothers and the Federal Minister for Interior.

doc.seg: The meeting between the largest centrist opposition party and the ruling party in Punjab was held in Raiwind on Sunday. In attendance were Pakistan Muslim League leader Nawaz Sharif; Federal Minister for Interior Rehman Malik; and Chief Minister of Punjab Shahbaz Sharif.
Local media states Rehman Malik delivered a message from the leadership of Pakistan People's Party.

However, talking to journalists after the meeting, Rehman Malik did not mention any details about this matter, stating only that he came to talk about building consensus on political issues and to brief the PML(N)’s leadership on the aftermath of the Mumbai attacks.
Malik stated “I informed them about the steps which have been taken thus far.""
“Don’t forget that the major crackdown was done in Punjab by the Punjab government, and the team that I have formed now will also require help from the Punjab government.""

Rehman Malik said that the media is not briefed every day; however, messages are exchanged with PML(N)’s leadership on daily basis. Spokesman for the Pakistan Muslim League, Pervaiz Rasheed, also refrained from talking about any of the political issues, stating only that Rehman Malik had stated everything of importance.

It should be noted that the Interior Minister met with the Pakistan Muslim League’s leadership at the same time when twenty Nazims belonging to PML(Q), the opposition party in Punjab, held a press conference with Governor Salman Taseer. PML(N), while dismissing the objections of the Nazims against steps taken by the provincial government, objected to the involvement in this matter of the Punjab governor, a member of Pakistan Peoples Party.

hl.seg: President Zardari stated ""Pakistan is pleased with Obama's speech.""

doc.seg: Concerning American President Barak Obama's inaugural address, Pakistan's president, Asif Ali Zardari, stated that it is in our mutual interest to be receptive to dialogue between the Muslim world and the United States, as encouraged by President Obama.
In a statement on Wednesday, he said the revisions of high values and respect by the President of The United States is good for all of the people in the world for a better future.
President Zardari has stated the responsibility lies with America to search for new ways of peace, development, and prosperity with the help of universal brothers in the twenty first century.
President Obama, in his inaugural address, has said that America is interested in developing new ties and relationships with the Muslim world.
He assured the people of poor countries that America should work with them for social development and to reduce poverty.

hl.seg: President Obama has appointed a special representative for Afghanistan and Pakistan.

doc.seg: Former ambassador for the UN Richard Holbrook has been appointed as special representative for Pakistan and Afghanistan.
Holbrook has played an important role in the signing of a peace agreement with Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Holbrook said he is ready to consult with President Obama about Afghanistan and Pakistan.
He added that it is not an easy job.
He said that the history of both countries is different.
George Mitchell has been selected for the Middle East dialogue, to try to improve the peace talks between Arabs and Israel.
Mitchell is a former senator, and has played a key role in the establishment of peace in Northern Ireland.
While speaking in the State Department, Mitchell has said that the situation of Middle East is very dangerous, complex and unpredictable.
But America will not step back from the attempts of establishment of peace.

hl.seg: Strict security is in place for India Republic Day.

doc.seg: The 60th India Republic Day is being observed on Monday, under strict security for every occasion throughout the country.
The Republic in New Delhi plans a military parade of weapons, planes and other military equipment to the exhibition.
Officials say that security arrangements under the Anti-Terrorism Acts will be carried out during the parade of police and on the roads. The American president congratulated India on this occasion.
And on Saturday, Prime Minister Manmohan Singh sent a message for the occasion, while recovering from heart surgery.

hl.seg: Tea: An effective treatment of Lung Cancer.

doc.seg: New research shows that drinking three cups of tea day
greatly reduces the risk of the lung cancer in women under the age of 50.
This research from the Moffet Cancer Centre in Florida says that the chances of contracting lung cancer in women under the age of 50
who drink tea three times a day, are reduced by 37%
The research also said that having more than three cups of tea daily in women over the age of 50 has on special benefits.
Experts believe that the reason behind this is that tea has some elements that are effective against the formation of cancer cells in women mainly under the age of 50.
More than 5000 women who had lung cancer were treated in the Moffet Cancer Center in Tampa, Florida.
They were aged between 29 to 74.
Researchers compared their medical records and lifestyles to women who were free of lung cancer.
Experts also discovered that tea was mainly effective on a certain type of cancer called lopler, and was reduced by 66%.
Every 10th lung cancer patient falls under this type of cancer.
This type of cancer is especially dangerous because it is deeper than most, and is usually only discoverable when it has spread significantly.
Experts say that younger females can greatly reduce the risk of lung cancer by regularly drinking three cups of tea every day.
They say that incorporating tea in daily life can greatly reduce the risk of any cancer.
In Britain, more than 40,000 women are diagnosed with lung cancer every year.

hl.seg: War in Afghanistan is the biggest military challenge for America.

doc.seg: American Secretary of Defense Robert Gates has said that the war in Afghanistan is the biggest military challenge for America.
Gates today briefed Obama about Afghanistan and Iraq war preparations.
Gates said that only war is not the solution for problems in Afghanistan; he also said while many areas are safer, there is not sufficient military force to defeat the Taliban.

hl.seg: Why do people exercise less as they get older?
New Research.

doc.seg: Exercise is good for health at any age.
This makes your heart stronger, decreases cholesterol levels, helps in reducing weight, helps stop diabetes and decreases the chances of Alzheimer's.
Unfortunately, a lot of people tend to exercise less with age.
Experts say that exercise keeps our minds and bodies alert, and affects the real age of a person.
According to the American Medical Association, not getting enough exercise can lead to numerous health issues.
Dr. Patricia Paylekka of the Mew Clinic of Minnesota reports that with the increase in age, exercise is a major factor in determining proper body functioning.
Dr Patricia teaches medicine at the Mew Clinic.
She has done extensive research on older age and the ability to exercise with the increase of age.
A team of doctors have used high frequency rays to determine the functioning of the heart.
The ability of the heart to pump blood, and it's ability to shrink and relax was researched.
Experts have concentrated mainly on the left side of the heart, which is mainly responsible for the pumping of blood.
They discovered that with increase in age, the problems in the rate of heart, relaxation also increase.
Dr. Patricia says that with increase in age, the problems in the heart relaxation rates increases and thus effects the ability to exercise with growing age.
Dr. Carwin Cain was also part of this research.
He says that it's surprising to see the permanent effects of improper exercise on the heart.
In some instances, blood pressure is a factor in both heart anomalies and diseases.
If doctors and patients can work together on the problem of heart disease, then they can enjoy the benefits of exercise even with older age.
A detailed report concerning this appeared in the American Medical Association Publication.

hl.seg: According to the Army Chief of India, war with Pakistan is not imminent.

doc.seg: Indian Army Chief General Deepak Kapoor says war with Pakistan is not imminent; however, it is in the best interests of the country to remain prepared to defend her interests.
General Kapoor claimed that despite assurances and international pressure following the Mumbai attacks, the terrorism network is not only present in Pakistan but is also active.
He said this while speaking to correspondents in Srinaga.
The Indian Army Chief was on a daylong tour of the New Delhi-administered Kashmir, where he viewed the army's border preparations and defense system.
He was asked his opinion on the reports that Pakistan has denied responsibility for the attacks on Mumbai.
General Kapoor said that decisions of war and peace are controlled by political leaders.
Talking about the alleged terrorism network in Pakistan, he said that Indian Army will have to face the forces whose object is to destroy peace and weaken India.
He said that 700 to 800 militants are present in Indian Kashmir, almost half of them foreigners.
General Deepak Kapoor said as the weather improves attempts of attack from Pakistan and her side of Kashmir may increase; India, however, has increased security on her borders.
He refused the chances of reducing the number of deployed army in Indian administered Kashmir by saying that no compromise on country security.

Most elders of our family belonged to labor class.
And when we in our childhood we used to see our uncles doing strenuous labor it gave birth to this desire in our heart that God protects us from strenuous physical labor.
To seek refuge from it we wrote a letter to the editor of daily Amroz and asked “what should we do after matriculation exams that we don’t have to go through strenuous physical labor.
Editor in his reply wrote that we should become a doctor or an engineer and should opt for such and such subjects to study.
From the beginning we were inclined toward engineering and also in metric we opted for technical drawing instead of biology.
But at the time of admission in FSC elder brother insisted on doing FSC in Pre Medical and become a doctor.
We hardly studied biology for a month and when we couldn’t understand a thing we swapped biology for Mathematics.
It means that the fear of strenuous physical jobs made us to become engineers and now we are well placed among many the youth of our family and for this we are thankful to God
This we remembered when we were trying to lift carpet from our old house with our two young sons.
We were not even thirty minutes into our working that our younger son said “Dad, it feels like I am not born for this job.""
We said that if that is true then study hard like us and free yourself from physical labor.
Our younger son started saying, ""I am studying and will complete my studies but I can’t do this work.""
The three of us somehow managed to finish the job and get back home.
It means that when a man decides the destination, no matter what the motives were behind this, no one can stop him from getting it.
But if you don’t even know what you have to do, then God be with you.

Humanity will be wiped out in the 21st century.
Today is the age of computers, and computers' influence is growing in every aspect of life.
Lots of people have many reservations about this growing influence of computers, like in financial issues.
You can use credit cards, but this gives law enforcement agencies a firmer grip on your private life.
They can track your credit card records to expose you.
In the future, less physical currency will be used, and its utility will increase.
Similarly, you don't have to rob a bank to commit a financial crime when you can break into credit card records.
Similarly, friendship has become computerized.
Social networking websites like Orcet, Facebook and MySpace are the most popular.
However, as people spend more time on these sites, they spend less time around other actual people.

American high officials have stated that President Obama will take a stern attitude towards the Afghan President Hamid Karzai.
The new American strategy towards Afghanistan will focus on war instead of development.

The officials said that Hamid Karzai is viewed as an obstacle in achieving American interests in Afghanistan because of government corruption, a rise in drug trafficking, and the Taliban's increasing strength.

The American officials also said that those people in the current administration who are pressuring Hamid Karzai to do more include Vice President Joe Biden and American Envoy for Afghanistan and Pakistan Richard Holbrook.

They stated that the policy change came after President Bush left office. The former president used to have video conferences with Hamid Karzai, and emphasized America's role in the rebuilding of Afghanistan and its civil institutions.
The Obama administration will work with provincial political leaders instead of the central government.
They said that they will ask Hamid Karzai to intensify the campaign against corruption.
Hamid Karzai is facing new elections this year and it is not yet clear whether President Obama and his administration are going to back him up in the presidential race.
Does this statement reflect a shift in American policy toward Afghanistan?
Is Hamid Karzai’s era coming to an end?
What is your say on this?
